sentences.english: This city is noted for its manufacture of earthenware .
sentences.chinese: 这城市以陶器的制造而出名。

sentences.english: Delft is a blue - and - white ware.
sentences.chinese: 代尔夫特精陶是一种蓝白色的陶器。

sentences.english: The production of red pottery still needs the traditional method.
sentences.chinese: 紫砂陶器的生产，仍需沿用传统的方式。

sentences.english: Because stoneware is nonporous, glaze is applied only for decoration.
sentences.chinese: 因为石陶器是致密的，所以上釉只是为了装饰。

sentences.english: Jasmine and climbing plants are placed in some large ceramic pots.
sentences.chinese: 茉莉和攀援植物被种植在一些大型的陶器中。

sentences.english: These exhibits includes some fine examples of medieval pottery.
sentences.chinese: 这些展览品中包括一些中世纪陶器精品。

sentences.english: There's an exhibition of pottery-making at the fair.
sentences.chinese: 在集市上有陶器制作的示范表演。

sentences.english: Pottery utensils for daily use were chiefly made from refined terracotta and red sandy clay.
sentences.chinese: 日用陶器以细泥红陶和夹砂红褐陶为主。

sentences.english: This hall exhibits jade ware and ceramics.
sentences.chinese: 这个馆陈列的是玉器和陶器。

sentences.english: Seige from Australia has purchased a lot of Crockery from Jiangsu Art &Craft Import &Export Company.
sentences.chinese: 他已向江苏工艺品进出口公司购买了一大批陶器货物。

sentences.english: They both liked 1)antiques and pottery and especially teacups .
sentences.chinese: 他们俩都喜欢古董和陶器，尤其喜爱茶杯。

sentences.english: The Anasazi culture were also skilled at forming the natural clays into pottery.
sentences.chinese: 阿纳萨奇人还擅长于用粘土制作陶器。

sentences.english: Besides, pottery is differed from the local Peiligang culture of later period.
sentences.chinese: 与本地区年代稍晚的裴李岗文化陶器有明显区别。

sentences.english: They used a method called "faience", which is normally used for earthenware .
sentences.chinese: 他们使用了一种叫做“彩陶”，这是通常用于陶器。

sentences.english: Mr. Sahin makes ceramic dishes and wall hangings.
sentences.chinese: 他是制作陶器和墙幔的工匠。

sentences.english: There's an exhibition of pottery-making at the fair.
sentences.chinese: 在集市场上有陶器制作的示范表演。

definition: bronze implement/refers to ancient bronze artifacts, from c. 2,000 BC
black eggshell pottery (of the Neolithic Longshan culture)
to dig up/to appear in an excavation/unearthed/to come up out of the ground
